newsitem.title: PERU: Peru central bank offers 45 mln soles 28-day CDs.
newsitem.headline: Peru central bank offers 45 mln soles 28-day CDs.

text.p: The Central Reserve Bank of Peru announced Tuesday an auction of Certificates of Deposit (CDs), saying it would accept bids for 28-day CDs worth 45 million soles until 1430 local time/1530 EDT BCQZ.
All the certificates have a June 11 starting date.
Last year the bank regularly held auctions on Tuesdays and Thursdays, but has limited its sales in 1997 due to a lack of liquidity in the financial system.
Tuesday's sale will be the bank's second auction in less than a week. Until last Thursday, the bank had not held a CD auction for two months.
The average effective annual interest rate for the certificates, which will be announced after the auction, is used as an informal indicator for interest rates in the Peruvian financial system.
